oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from J. S. Harrison to wife
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter to "Dear Dear Wife" (J. E. Harrison), written by a soldier in Wartburg, saying that he is in good health and spirits. Harrison describes the difficulty of marching "day and knight," once going "20 miles on one of those tramps stopping only to cook." Letter is in fragile condition. See also whit006.
